prompt_sent_to_api:
You are a senior clinical geneticist. Your task is to synthesize findings from the provided analytical tool reports into a single, ranked list of potential diagnoses.

Create a master list of all unique disease candidates from all reports. Then, rank them from most to least plausible based on the strength of the evidence (consensus across tools, high scores/ranks).

Your final output must be a numbered list. Each line should contain only the rank, disease name, and OMIM ID. Do not include any reasoning or other text.

**Example Output:**
1. DISEASE NAME 1 (OMIM:XXXXXX)
2. DISEASE NAME 2 (OMIM:YYYYYY)
3. DISEASE NAME 3 (OMIM:ZZZZZZ)

---
INPUT CONTEXT

II. Analytical Tool Reports

PubCaseFinder Report (Phenotype-based):
- Peters plus syndrome (Score: 0.819)
- craniofacial dysmorphism, skeletal anomalies, and impaired intellectual development 1 (Score: 0.810)
- cardiofaciocutaneous syndrome 1 (Score: 0.792)
- osteopathia striata with cranial sclerosis (Score: 0.791)
- skin creases, congenital symmetric circumferential, 2 (Score: 0.780)

Zero-Shot Diagnosis Report (Generative AI-based):
- CHARGE SYNDROME (Rank: 1)
- KABUKI SYNDROME 1; KABUK1 (Rank: 2)
- NOONAN SYNDROME 12; NS12 (Rank: 3)
- VATER/VACTERL ASSOCIATION (Rank: 4)
- BRANCHIOOTORENAL SYNDROME 1; BOR1 (Rank: 5)

GestaltMatcher Report (Facial Dysmorphology-based):
- Cardiofaciocutaneous syndrome (Score: 0.538)
- CEBALID SYNDROME; CEBALID (Score: 0.518)
- Noonan syndrome (Score: 0.512)
- SCHINZEL-GIEDION MIDFACE RETRACTION SYNDROME (Score: 0.490)
- NEUROFIBROMATOSIS-NOONAN SYNDROME; NFNS (Score: 0.487)

Phenotype Similarity Search Report (Vector-based):
- CARDIOSPONDYLOCARPOFACIAL SYNDROME (OMIM: 157800, Score: 0.859)
- THROMBOCYTOPENIA 11 WITH MULTIPLE CONGENITAL ANOMALIES AND DYSMORPHIC FACIES (OMIM: 620654, Score: 0.859)
- BURATTI-HAREL SYNDROME (OMIM: 619314, Score: 0.850)
- NEUROFACIOSKELETAL SYNDROME WITH OR WITHOUT RENAL AGENESIS (OMIM: 619194, Score: 0.850)
- CONGENITAL HYPOTONIA, EPILEPSY, DEVELOPMENTAL DELAY, AND DIGITAL ANOMALIES (OMIM: 618494, Score: 0.848)

III. Supporting Literature
Web Search Results (Literature/Case Reports):
- Title: Noonan syndrome 13 (Concept Id: C5436773) - MedGen - NCBI
  Snippet: The provided text is incomplete and does not contain sufficient information to create a structured summary as per the requested format. If you can provide the full article or additional context, I can assist further.
- Title: 4p partial monosomy syndrome (Concept Id: C1956097) - MedGen -
  Snippet: The provided text appears to be medical in nature, specifically related to Wolf-Hirschhorn syndrome. However, the excerpt is incomplete and does not provide sufficient clinical details to create a structured summary. If you can provide the full article or additional information, I can proceed with the requested summary.
